Felix Lucka

welcome to my academic web site

New paper on fast Gibbs sampling online

01 Mar 2016

I finally submitted a paper about the extension to the single component Gibbs sampler that allows to sample a lot more types of posteriors in Bayesian inversion. It is titled “Fast Gibbs sampling for high-dimensional Bayesian inversion” and after lying around for quite a bit as a draft, I now finalized it and submitted it to Inverse Problems. The pre-print can be found on arXiv.

New paper on the PAT adjoint online

08 Feb 2016

We submitted a new paper titled “On the Adjoint Operator in Photoacoustic Tomography” to Inverse Problems! The pre-print can be found on arXiv, code to reproduce the numerical examples will soon follow.

New paper on EEG head modeling online

01 Feb 2016

We just published a paper titled “The role of blood vessels in high-resolution volume conductor head modeling of EEG” in NeuroImage! It can be found here, and an image from it was elected as the cover of NeuroImage’s next issue, 128. Big thanks to the first author Lukas Fiederer!

Transferred contents from the old site

23 Aug 2015

After some more traveling, I finally managed to transfer the contents of my old web site at the WWU to this new site. They are plain and unformatted right now, but I’ll think about some way to arrange them in a more appealing fashion.

This site is online?!?

28 Jul 2015

Yes, it is! It’s a fairly accurate representation of my poor webdesign skills, but nevertheless, I’m trying to fill it with some useful stuff.

(I’m using Jekyll as a static site generator.)
